wesm commented on issue #2428: [WIP] ARROW-1968: [C++/Python] Add basic unit tests for ORC reader
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2428#issuecomment-412748377
 
 
   Hm, if you `git gc` and trim your local branches it's smaller:
   
   ```
   $ git clone git@github.com:apache/arrow.git arrow-clean
   Cloning into 'arrow-clean'...
   remote: Counting objects: 28800, done.
   remote: Compressing objects: 100% (20/20), done.
   remote: Total 28800 (delta 8), reused 12 (delta 5), pack-reused 28775
   Receiving objects: 100% (28800/28800), 14.05 MiB | 5.01 MiB/s, done.
   Resolving deltas: 100% (19879/19879), done.
   (arrow-dev) 23:58 ~/code $ cd arrow-clean/
   (arrow-dev) 23:58 ~/code/arrow-clean  (master)$ du -d 1 .git
   8.0K	.git/info
   15M	.git/objects
   52K	.git/hooks
   28K	.git/refs
   32K	.git/logs
   16M	.git
   ```
   
   vs 
   
   ```
   $ ..
   (arrow-dev) 23:58 ~/code $ git clone git@github.com:apache/orc.git orc-clean
   Cloning into 'orc-clean'...
   remote: Counting objects: 15979, done.
   remote: Compressing objects: 100% (22/22), done.
   remote: Total 15979 (delta 2), reused 8 (delta 1), pack-reused 15956
   Receiving objects: 100% (15979/15979), 21.92 MiB | 4.96 MiB/s, done.
   Resolving deltas: 100% (9591/9591), done.
   (arrow-dev) 23:59 ~/code $ cd orc-clean
   (arrow-dev) 23:59 ~/code/orc-clean  (master)$ du -d 1 .git
   8.0K	.git/info
   23M	.git/objects
   52K	.git/hooks
   28K	.git/refs
   32K	.git/logs
   23M	.git
   ```
   
   Maybe it makes sense to create an auxiliary repository for static testing data (which can be snapshotted into release tarballs). What do you think?

wesm commented on issue #2428: ARROW-1968: [C++/Python] Add basic unit tests for ORC reader
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2428#issuecomment-412951772
 
 
   Okay. It can be a slippery slope -- 1MB is OK but IMHO 50MB is not. The "git is forever" thing is bothersome -- if we check these files in, we'll never be rid of them (unless we rewrite history with `git filter-branch`, but that's a last resort); every clone and every CI build will download them. 
   
   So if we find ourselves tempted to add more binary files in the future, we should reconsider the strategy. 

----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #2428: ARROW-1968: [C++/Python] Add basic unit tests for ORC reader
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2428#issuecomment-413600913
 
 
   I'm sorry to obsess over the file sizes, but I'm looking at
   
   ```
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm  19313 Aug 16 12:12 decimal.jsn.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm  16337 Aug 16 12:12 decimal.orc
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm  25093 Aug 16 12:12 decimal.pickle.bz2
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm   2547 Aug 16 12:12 json_to_pickle.py
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm    934 Aug 16 12:12 README.md
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm     50 Aug 16 12:12 TestOrcFile.emptyFile.jsn.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm    523 Aug 16 12:12 TestOrcFile.emptyFile.orc
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm    323 Aug 16 12:12 TestOrcFile.test1.jsn.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm   1711 Aug 16 12:12 TestOrcFile.test1.orc
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm    607 Aug 16 12:12 TestOrcFile.test1.pickle.bz2
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm 182453 Aug 16 12:12 TestOrcFile.testDate1900.jsn.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm  30941 Aug 16 12:12 TestOrcFile.testDate1900.orc
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm 994703 Aug 16 12:12 TestOrcFile.testDate1900.pickle.bz2
   ```
   
   Is there a reason to check in the bzipped pickle? Dropping TestOrcFile.testDate1900.pickle.bz2 would save nearly a megabyte

wesm commented on issue #2428: ARROW-1968: [C++/Python] Add basic unit tests for ORC reader
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2428#issuecomment-413657276
 
 
   I'm sufficiently bothered about this that I'm going to set up https://github.com/apache/arrow-testing and move the test data files there if that's ok. I don't know that it's worth the cost to ship these files with wheels / conda packages, for example. We need to deal with the data files for Parquet also https://github.com/apache/parquet-cpp/tree/master/data
   
   If the user has set a `ARROW_TEST_DATA` environment variable then tests requiring the auxiliary data files will be run, otherwise they'll be skipped, or something like that.

wesm commented on issue #2428: ARROW-1968: [C++/Python] Add basic unit tests for ORC reader
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2428#issuecomment-413675698
 
 
   I agree; my argument is that it's inevitable that we're going to have to do this at some point. It could be now or a year from now
   
   What I'd be proposing is for users to add these steps to their development process
   
   ```
    2053  git clone git@github.com:wesm/arrow.git submodule-arrow-test
    2057  git checkout testing-submodule 
    2058  git submodule init
    2059  git submodule update
    2061  export ARROW_TEST_DATA=`pwd`/submodules/arrow-testing/data
   ```
   
   see https://github.com/wesm/arrow/tree/testing-submodule
   
   You could skip these steps and the affected tests would be skipped

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

   I agree; my argument is that it's inevitable that we're going to have to do this at some point. It could be now or a year from now
   
   What I'd be proposing is for users to add these steps to their development process
   
   ```
    2053  git clone git@github.com:wesm/arrow.git submodule-arrow-test
    2054  cd submodule-arrow-test
    2057  git checkout testing-submodule 
    2058  git submodule init
    2059  git submodule update
    2061  export ARROW_TEST_DATA=`pwd`/submodules/arrow-testing/data
   ```
   
   see https://github.com/wesm/arrow/tree/testing-submodule
   
   You could skip these steps and the affected tests would be skipped

wesm commented on issue #2428: ARROW-1968: [C++/Python] Add basic unit tests for ORC reader
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2428#issuecomment-413680270
 
 
   Maybe to also motivate my mania about this:
   
   ```
   $ ll ~/arrow-thirdparty/
   total 159556
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm 103363944 Apr 11 10:31 boost.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm  19838761 Jul 16 22:38 brotli.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm    681752 Jul 16 22:38 flatbuffers.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm    126850 Jul 16 22:38 gbenchmark.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm     96408 Jul 16 22:38 gflags.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm  13692045 Jul 16 22:38 grpc.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm   1281617 Jul 16 22:38 gtest.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm    208019 Jul 16 22:38 lz4.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm  13390471 Jul 16 22:38 orc.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm   2609846 May 20  2017 protobuf.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm   1019402 Jul 16 22:38 rapidjson.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm   1509026 May 21  2017 snappy.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm   3667154 Dec  7  2017 thrift.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm    571091 Apr 28  2013 zlib.tar.gz
   -rw-rw-r-- 1 wesm wesm   1300584 Jul 16 22:38 zstd.tar.gz
   ```
   
   So the size of the Boost tarball is a bit ridiculous, but two other large dependencies Brotli and ORC are large precisely because of shipping binary files (and built Javadoc). I'm routinely developing on plane wifi or mobile hotspot and this kind of thing drives me nuts; so if we check in binary files, we're doing exactly the thing that I hate =) 
   
   I'm willing to let it go for now so long as the _next time_ someone wants to check in binary files we do the right thing
